Text.text: What is your primary responsibility as an advisee?
Periodically inform your advisor on how your classes are going
Incorrect: this is not your primary requirement as an advisee.
Share information from your advisor with your classmates
Incorrect: this is not your primary requirement as an advisee.
Schedule meetings with your advisor each semester
Correct: you should meet with your advisor each semester for help choosing and enrolling in classes.
You have no responsibilities beyond what your advisor suggests you to do
Incorrect: try again.
What is the advisorâ€™s primary role?
Help the student adjust to campus life
Incorrect: this task is better suited for the Division of Student Life or your resident assistant.
Answer any questions the student has about programs at the university
Incorrect: this task is better suited for the Division of Student Life.
Provide guidance regarding coursework
Correct: this is the primary responsibility of an advisor.
All of the above
Incorrect: not all of these are responsibilities of an advisor.
Who is NOT the best person to go to if you're having trouble adjusting to college?
Your advisor
Correct! Your advisor can help you in many ways, but he/she is not trained to listen to problems which are not related to your classes and your major.
Your resident assistant
Incorrect: if you live in the dorms, your resident assistant can be very helpful with helping you adjust to campus life. Try again!
Center for Counseling and Student Development
Incorrect: the Counseling Center is a safe place for you to talk about any issues you struggle with. Try again!
A close friend
Incorrect: try again!
How often is it suggested for you to meet with an advisor?
Once a year
Incorrect. Try again!
Only when you want to switch your major
Incorrect: your advisor can also help you choose classes to take and decide on a major. Try again!
Once a semester
Correct! It is best to meet with your advisor once a semester to discuss which classes to take and to check that you're on track with your degree requirements.
Three times a semester
Incorrect: try again!
Which is NOT one of the responsibilities of an advisor?
To answer questions if you're considering changing your major
Incorrect: your advisor can give you information on different majors to help you decide what to major in. Try again!
To meet with you whenever you ever need to talk or have some personal issues to work through
Correct, this is not a responsibility of an advisor! The Center for Counseling and Student Development is better suited to help you with personal issues.
To help you decide which classes to take
Incorrect: your advisor can help you choose which courses to take to fulfill your degree requirements. Try again!
To help you figure out what to do if you want to withdraw from a course you're struggling with
Incorrect: your advisor can give you advice on what to do if you're having a difficult semester and help you rearrange your future semesters so you can still graduate as soon as possible.
Where do you meet with your advisor?
Anywhere on campus
Incorrect. Try again!
In any classroom building
Incorrect. Try again!
At the Center for Academic Advisement
Incorrect. Try again!
In your advisor's office
